intro: Ouratea arbobrevicalyx, commonly known as the small-leaved ouratea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, ovate to elliptic leaves. Its small, white to pale pink flowers are clustered in cymes and are often fragrant. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, elongated seeds.
